chapter.title: Environments
chapter.para: In this chapter, we mean by environment a piece of ICT infrastructure with elements that belong together. For example, we have a development environment, in which we have a network, some computer machines, an LDAP service, a DNS service, a Provisioning service (Spacewalk), etc. In other words, it is an infrastructure domain in which we provide different services and machines. Since we call it development environment, we give the suggestion that we develop in this environment.

warning.title: The notion of environment in this chapter must not be confused witht the Puppet parameter $enviornment.
warning.para: In the Puppet configuration one can set the parameter $environment, to define the set of configuration parameters used according to the Puppet Directory environments mechanism. Since the environment notion in this chapter also yields a puppet Parameter, we name it $depzone, for Deployment zone.
